description:
These additional configuration options define metadata and appearance of executables for Windows platform. Every field is optional.

See https://neutralino.js.org/docs/configuration/neutralino.config.json#windows-specific-options for more information.

applicationIcon.description:
The location of the executable's icon relative to neutralino.config.json. The icon must be in PNG format.
If it is not set, an icon from `modes.window.icon` will be chosen instead.
If `modes.window.icon` does not point to a PNG file, too, a default Neutralino.js icon will be used.

applicationName.description: The human-readable application name. Fills in the `ProductName` field of the executable.

author.description: The developer of the application. Fills in the `CompanyName` field of the executable.

copyright.description: Copyright information. Fills in the LegalCopyright field of the executable.

description.description: A description of the executable file. This usually describes the purpose of your application. Fills in the `FileDescription` field of the executable.
